Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Growl \Growl\ (groul), v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Growled} (grould); p. pr. & vb. n. {Growling}.] [D. grollen to grunt, murmur, be angry; akin to G. grollen to be angry.] To utter a deep guttural sound, as an angry dog; to give forth an angry, grumbling sound. --Gay. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Growl \Growl\, v. t. To express by growling. --Thomson. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Growl \Growl\, n. The deep, threatening sound made by a surly dog; a grumbling sound. [1913 Webster]

growl n : the sound of growling (as made by animals) [syn: {growling}] v : to utter or emit low dull rumbling sounds; "he grumbled a rude response"; "Stones grumbled down the cliff" [syn: {grumble}, {rumble}]
